div.p: VPRS 5834/P0/1, inward correspondence p. 48, VA 1411 Industrial and Technological Museum, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor of transmitting to you herewith an account of remuneration for work done by Mr C. Hoffmann for the technologic Museum up to date during September. It includes payment for the rest of the month, making a total of £14.6/-, being at the rate of 11/ for 26 days. This sum is due under the vote of labeling and putting in order exhibits, granted to the extent of £20. -. - by the Technologic Museum Commission. I would beg to ask, that the sum of £14.6/ may also be granted for Mr Hoffmanns work in October, in continuation of getting articles of vegetable substances ready under my direction for the industrial Museum. The exhibits prepared this month are now in the Museum.

I further beg to send two accounts for label printing, amounting to £9. — 6d. If the Commissioners would be so good to vote an other twenty pounds Sterling for the phytologic branch, all the expenditure til the end of October would be met, inclusive of small items of outlay.
MS annotation: ' 4th Octr 1870 […] attention to letter of 3d August cannot pay money for department of Dr Von Mueller.'
